intro: Neomolina pulchella, commonly known as the velvetleaf or silverleaf plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas and is characterized by its soft, velvety foliage and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are usually heart-shaped with a waxy texture, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Neomolina pulchella is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
